title.narrative: Provision of Life-Saving Nutrition and WASH Services to emergency-affected vulnerable populations

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide essential Nutrition and WASH services to children, women and communities affected by conflict, drought and the impact of COVID-19. This UNICEF project 1) distributes therapeutic supplies to people with Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM), 2) provides hygiene supplies and 3) installs emergency sanitation facilities among other activities. The project provides life-saving assistance to 80,000 people, including 21,700 women, 22,900 men, 35,400 children, and 3,400 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provision of Life-Saving Nutrition and WASH Services to emergency-affected vulnerable populations
Disbursement to CERF Project Provision of Life-Saving Nutrition and WASH Services to emergency-affected vulnerable populations

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: A total of 32,449 children aged 6-59 months with Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) are provided with lifesaving therapeutic supplies (RUTF and milks)
# of RUTF cartons procured and dispatched to the 10 priority and highly affected provincesQuantity of special nutritious foods (RUTF) provided
# of children aged under-five with SAM who are admitted for treatment# SAM new admissions (children)
# of health facilities (fixed and mobile) supplied with therapeutic food.

# of therapeutic milk (F-100 type) cartons procured and dispatched to Inpatient Department (IPD)-SAM wards in 10 priority provincesQuantity of special nutritious foods (therapeutic milk F-100) provided
# of therapeutic milk (F-75 type) cartons procured and dispatched to IPD_SAM wards in 10 priority provincesQuantity of special nutritious foods (therapeutic milk F-75) provided

An estimated 40,000 vulnerable people affected by conflict and natural disaster (drought/flood/landslide) and conflict access safe drinking water through trucking, rehabilitation of existing systems, or installation of new water supply systems
Number of people in affected areas with access to at least 15 liters per capita per day (lpcd) of safe water drinking water

Number of public institutions (such as temporary learning centers, mobile health teams, healthcare facilities, nutrition centers, schools or child friendly spaces) with access to WASH facilities/services

An estimated 84,000 people affected by natural disaster (drought/flood/landslide) and conflict including most vulnerable people in host communities have improved knowledge and perform healthy hygienic behaviors and practices (this includes provision of sanitation facilities including bathing spaces and handwashing stations for an estimated 8,000 displaced people affected by natural disasters and conflict)
Number of affected people who receive hygiene supplies and orientation on key hygiene messages as per WASH cluster standard
Number of displaced people with access to sanitation facilities/services (latrines, bathing spaces and handwashing stations)
